answers.answer: Hi,The symptoms experienced by you could be due to 'Occipital neuralgia'. In this condition the occipital nerve becomes inflammed and sensitive.It can be due to trauma (a direct blow or "whiplash"); spinal column compression; nerve lesions; localized infections or inflammation; gout; diabetes; blood vessel inflammation; and local tumors.Taking a neurologist opinion will help in confirming the diagnosis..

Thanks Anant10, this makes sense since I suffer from spinal compression in my neck due to whip lash I had few months ago. Over the last few weeks/months I experienced neck pain when sleeping and it takes a considerable amount of pillow adjustment to sleep comfortably.Anyways, I'll consult the doc to see how/if we can fix the problem.

question: Hi,I'm a 29 year old healthy male. I'm experiencing very sharp pain episodes in the back of my head, 3cm to the left of center just above the top of my ear line. The pain spells feels like someone is pulling my hair out and lasts for a few seconds, then disappear. The spot where the pain was experienced, about 2cm in diameter, feels a little sensitive most of the time between these pain episodes when I apply pressure to the spot with my thumb.  Time between these episodes range between a few minutes up to a few hours. I've been experiencing this for the past few days.Any ideas what this could be.
title: Someone is pulling my hair out - or so it feels... Please help!?
